item.title: Java Posse #420 - Roundup '13
item.description:
Roundup ‘13 - Episode 420

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com

  • Crested Butte

    • http://www.skicb.com/cbmr/index.aspx

  • What’s it like?

    • https://www.google.com/search?site=&tbm=isch&source=hp&q=java+posse+roundup&oq=java+posse+roundup

  • Episode 420

    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/420_(cannabis_culture)

Thanks

  • Libsyn.com - http://www.libsyn.com - for hosting and bandwidth

  • Feedburner.com - http://www.feedburner.com - for feed redirect

  • Kirsty Doherty, Amy Ehmann for Java Posse artwork

  • Theme Music:

    • Opening - "Java" the parody song Copyright 1997 Broken Records and Marjorie Music Publ. (BMI),

      • written and performed by Loose Bruce Kerr of the Dr. Demento Show and Sun Microsystems attorney.

      • Based on the WWI popular song, "Ja-da." Ukelele style on the recording taught to Bruce by his dad.

      • Re-produced with kind permission from "Loose" Bruce Kerr - http://loosebrucekerr.libsyn.com http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TAX0gJt-aZg

    • Closing - Juan Carlos Jimenez - In the House (Intro No. 1)

  • To contact us:

    • Visit our homepage - http://javaposse.com

    • Post on our Google Group - http://groups.google.com/group/javaposse

    • Pose a question on our Google Moderator group - http://tinyurl.com/q4javaposse

    • Call us with questions and feedback - (408) 465-4626

    • Or send us email - javaposse@gmail.com


The Java Posse consists of Tor Norbye, Carl Quinn, Chet Haase and Dick Wall

item.title: Java Posse #419 - Roundup '13 - Big Data
item.description:
Roundup ‘13 - Big Data

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com

    • Airline Magazine Article

  • http://www.hemispheresmagazine.com/2013/02/01/big-data-is-watching-you/

    • Neo4J

  • http://www.neo4j.org/

    • MongoDB

  • http://www.mongodb.org/

    • Cassandra

  • http://cassandra.apache.org/

    • NoSQL

  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NoSQL

    • Map/Reduce

  • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MapReduce

    • IBM Big Data

  • http://www-01.ibm.com/software/data/bigdata/

    • Hadoop

  • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apache_Hadoop

    • Pig

  • http://pig.apache.org/

    • Jaql

  • https://code.google.com/p/jaql/

    • HBase

  • http://hbase.apache.org/

    • Sunlight Sitegeist

  • http://sitegeist.sunlightfoundation.com/

    • Clojure

  • http://clojure.org/

    • Datomic

  • http://www.datomic.com/

    • ZeroMQ

  • http://www.zeromq.org/

    • TwitterStorm

  • http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/opensource/library/os-twitterstorm/

    • IBM Streams

  • http://www-01.ibm.com/software/data/infosphere/streams/

    • Esper

  • http://esper.codehaus.org/

    • Ubuntu

  • http://www.ubuntu.com/

    • Linux Mint

  • http://www.linuxmint.com/

item.title: Java Posse #418 - "Dickless"
item.description:
“Dickless”

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com


  • Interfaces, classes, and API design
    Blog:     http://graphics-geek.blogspot.com/2013/03/for-api-nerds-interfaces-and-inner.html
    Default Methods:     http://www.techempower.com/blog/2013/03/26/everything-about-java-8/
    Java Modules JSR (dormant):     http://jcp.org/en/jsr/detail?id=277

  • Scala Traits: http://www.scala-lang.org/node/126

  • Comments in source code

  • Life/work balance and being taken too seriously
    G+ post:     https://plus.google.com/104755487586666698979/posts/MgJS1XMHave

item.title: Java Posse #417
item.description:
Java Posse #417 - Newscast

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com


  • Roundup roundup
    https://plus.google.com/events/cirlus4c43cjhfm5rdahcenbp30

  • Google Reader and Google Keep
    Feedly:     http://www.feedly.com/
    Google Keep:     https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.keep

  • Google I/O
    https://developers.google.com/events/io/

  • Backup revisitation:
    http://www.crashplan.com/

  • Adobe exec goes to Apple
    http://www.theverge.com/2013/3/19/4124972/adobe-cto-kevin-lynch-allegedly-leaving-to-join-apples-ranks

  • JavaOne SF call for papers - conference from Sept 22 to 26 - deadline for paper proposals is April 12th
    https://blogs.oracle.com/theaquarium/entry/javaone_san_francisco_call_for

  • Also Scaladays 2013 - in NY - June 10th to 12th - deadline for paper proposals is April 15th
    http://scaladays.org/

  • Scala 2.10.1 released - strictly a bug fix release, but 166 bugs fixed!
    http://www.scala-lang.org/2.10.1

  • Discussion Idea - is Functional programming a better way for Big Data? http://www.slideshare.net/mobile/pacoid/functional-programming-for-optimization-problems-in-big-data

  • Samsung smartwatch http://news.slashdot.org/story/13/03/20/2041211/samsung-also-making-a-smartwatch?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed

  • Andy Rubin steps down as head of Android
    Sundar Pinchai to take over
    http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2013/03/update-from-ceo.html

  • Carl leaving Netflix. (Arguably more important than the Andy Rubin news :)
    http://www.riotgames.com/

Thanks

item.title: Java Posse #415 - A Waste of Time
item.description:
Java Posse #415 - A Waste of Time

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com

Java Posse Roundup 2013 - Feb 25th to March 1st in Crested Butte, CO. Big data in the cloud
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/
Scala training - San Jose March 18th to 22nd
http://www.artima.com/shop/stairway_to_scala?w=10070

  • Backup services
    • Crashplan - http://www.crashplan.com/
    • Carbonite - http://www.carbonite.com/en/v2/index
    • Jungledisk - https://www.jungledisk.com/
    • Amazon S3 - http://aws.amazon.com/s3/
    • Spideroak - https://spideroak.com/
    • Arq - http://www.haystacksoftware.com/arq/
  • Online drive services
    • Dropbox - https://www.dropbox.com/
    • Box.com - https://www.box.com/files
    • Google Drive - https://www.box.com/files
  • Java Posse Google Plus Group
    • https://plus.google.com/103002908895994700816/posts
  • Java Security
    • http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/tech/index-jsp-136007.html
    • http://www.informationweek.com/security/application-security/oracle-fixes-zero-day-java-flaws-patch-n/240146197
    • http://www.javaworld.com/community/node/8643
    • http://www.itechpost.com/articles/5652/20130221/java-exploits-used-zero-day-attacks-now-patched.htm
    • http://arstechnica.com/security/2013/02/facebook-computers-compromised-by-zero-day-java-exploit/
    • Java 7 U 15 - http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html
  • 3D Printers
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3D_printing
    • http://store.makerbot.com/3d-printers.html
  • Engineers do it forever
    • http://graphics-geek.blogspot.com/2013/02/engineers-do-it-forever.html
    • http://www.theverge.com/2013/2/13/3959868/photoshop-is-a-city-for-everyone-how-adobe-endlessly-rebuilds-its

  • AMQP
    • http://www.amqp.org/

item.title: Java Posse #409 - Roundup '12 - Two Things About Software Development
item.description:
Roundup ‘12 - Two Things About Software Development

Fully formatted shownotes can always be found at http://javaposse.com

Recorded at the Java Posse Roundup 2012 in Crested Butte, CO. Join us for the next Roundup, Feb 25th to March 1st. Big Data and the Cloud.
http://www.mindviewinc.com/Conferences/JavaPosseRoundup/

  • Two things about economics (and others)
    • http://www.csun.edu/~dgw61315/thetwothings.html
  • Two things about software?
    • People write software
    • Software serves people
    • Software solves problems
    • Software should not exist for its own sake
    • We work with abstractions...
    • To build abstractions
  • Genetic programming/algorithms
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_programming
  • Neural networks
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_neural_network
  • Proving a program correct
    • http://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2009/10/proving_a_compu.html
  • Voice recognition
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Speech_recognition
  • Software craftsmanship manifesto
    • http://manifesto.softwarecraftsmanship.org/
  • Observe, Orient, Decide, Act
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OODA_loop
  • Michael Jackson Software Engineering
    • http://mcs.open.ac.uk/mj665/
  • Lego and Duplo
    • http://duplo.lego.com/en-us/
    • http://www.lego.com/en-us/
  • Commodore 64
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commodore_64
  • Sinclair Spectrum
    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZX_Spectrum
  • Raspberry Pi
    • http://www.raspberrypi.org/
